text:
Katerina Ivanovna looked at Marmeladov with tears in her eyes. 

“My God! His whole chest is crushed!” 

She cried out in despair. 

“Turn a little, Semyon Zaharovitch,” she urged. 

Marmeladov recognized her. 

“A priest,” he husked. 

Katerina pressed her head against the window frame. 

“Oh, cursed life!” she exclaimed. 

“Barefoot, barefoot!” he muttered, eyes frantic. 

“Be silent,” she snapped. 

“Thank God, the doctor,” Raskolnikov said, relieved. 

Little Lida trembled in the corner, staring wide-eyed. 

Marmeladov's gaze softened as he looked at her.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna is in despair over Marmeladov's severe injuries and the dire situation of their family.
